temples.name: San Diego California Temple
temples.services: The temple provides clothing rental and has a distribution service nearby. There are no cafeteria services available, but the nearby Temple Inn & Suites has a 24 hour cafe.
temples.history: Announced on April 7, 1984, ground was not broken until February 27, 1988. It was dedicated on April 25, 1993.
temples.longhistory: The San Diego Temple was announced on April 17, 1984, and ground was broken on February 27, 1988. It was dedicated on April 25, 1993 by President Gordon B. Hinkley. It is the 47th temple constructed and the 45th operating temple of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.
temples.ordinanceschedule: Appointments are required for members to receive their own ordinances. Call or email the temple to schedule this type of appointment.
temples.sessionschedule: Temple sessions are scheduled in two hour blocks. Sessions are scheduled at 10AM, noon, and 2PM Monday through Saturday.

temples.name: Salt Lake Temple
temples.address: 50 W North Temple St, Salt Lake City, UT 84150
temples.services: Additional services are currently paused while renovations are being conducted
temples.history: The fourth temple built in Utah, the Salt Lake temple was announced on July 28, 1847 and dedicated by President Wilford Woodruff. It was the first temple to have a standing angel Moroni temple. It was dedicated between April 6-24 1893.
temples.longhistory: The fourth temple built in Utah, the Salt Lake temple was announced on July 28, 1847 and dedicated by President Wilford Woodruff. It was the first temple to have a standing angel Moroni on the steeple of the temple. It was dedicated between April 6-24 1893. The temple is the location of weekly meetings of the First Presidency and the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles.
temples.ordinanceschedule: Ordinance services are currently paused while renovations are being conducted
temples.sessionschedule: Session services are currently paused while renovations are being conducted

temples.name: Laie Temple
temples.services: The temple provides clothing rental and has a distribution service nearby. There are no cafeteria services available, but the nearby Temple Inn & Suites has a 24 hour cafe.
temples.history: Announced on October 3, 1915. Groundbreaking began on February 8, 1916, and the temple was dedicated on November 27, 1919. The temple was rededicated on June 13, 1978, and then again on November 21, 2010.
temples.longhistory: The Laie Hawaii Temple was announced on October 3, 1915, and ground was broken on February 8, 1916. The temple was dedicated by President Heber J. Grant on November 27, 1919. It is the first temple built outside the continental United States, the oldest to operate outside of Utah, and the fifth-oldest temple in operation.
temples.ordinanceschedule: Appointments are required for members to receive their own ordinances. Call or email the temple to schedule this type of appointment.
temples.sessionschedule: Temple sessions are scheduled in two hour blocks. Sessions are scheduled at 10AM, noon, and 2PM Monday through Saturday.

temples.name: Washington D.C. Temple
temples.services: Additional services are currently paused while renovations are being conducted
temples.history: Announced on November 15, 1968, groundbreaking occurred on December 7, 1968. The temple was dedicated on November 19, 1974.
temples.longhistory: The Washington D.C. Temple was announced on November 15, 1968 and groundbreaking began on December 7, 1968. It is the 18th temple constructed, and the 16th operating temple. The temple was dedicated on November 19, 1974.
temples.ordinanceschedule: Ordinance services are currently paused while renovations are being conducted
temples.sessionschedule: Session services are currently paused while renovations are being conducted
temples.templeclosureschedule: The temple will be dedicated on August 14, 2022, and open for patrons on August 30, 2022.
